intro: Dalechampia elongata, commonly known as the longleaf dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its elongated, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces small, clustered flowers with both male and female parts, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Dalechampia elongata is often found in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in wetlands.
